        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/126c6e32ebe7a2ceb603ffdee97639caee7d6eb4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/126c6e32ebe7a2ceb603ffdee97639caee7d6eb4"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/126c6e32ebe7a2ceb603ffdee97639caee7d6eb4<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>126c6e32ebe7a2ceb603ffdee97639caee7d6eb4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/126c6e32ebe7a2ceb603ffdee97639caee7d6eb4"><!---->126c6e32ebe7a2ceb603ffdee97639caee7d6eb4<!----></a><br>Author: Zakhar Voit <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Zakhar Voit &lt;<!----></span>voit@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/voit@google.com"><!---->voit@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Aug 24 10:54:26 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Aug 24 10:54:26 2022<!----></span><br><br>[M96-LTS] Ensure mouse lock widget pointers are cleared in WebContents destructor<span class="line"><!---->[M96-LTS] Ensure mouse lock widget pointers are cleared in WebContents destructor<!----></span><br><br>Requesting mouse/pointer lock (e.g., via requestPointerLock() from JS)<span class="line"><!---->Requesting mouse/pointer lock (e.g., via requestPointerLock() from JS)<!----></span><br>results in setting mouse_lock_widget_ to point to the<span class="line"><!---->results in setting mouse_lock_widget_ to point to the<!----></span><br>RenderWidgetHost that has the mouse lock, in both the widget's<span class="line"><!---->RenderWidgetHost that has the mouse lock, in both the widget's<!----></span><br>WebContents and all its outer WebContents.  When a WebContents is<span class="line"><!---->WebContents and all its outer WebContents.  When a WebContents is<!----></span><br>destroyed, it normally checks if it has an active mouse lock widget<span class="line"><!---->destroyed, it normally checks if it has an active mouse lock widget<!----></span><br>and calls RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() if so. This usually<span class="line"><!---->and calls RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() if so. This usually<!----></span><br>results in calling LostMouseLock(), which will clear<span class="line"><!---->results in calling LostMouseLock(), which will clear<!----></span><br>mouse_lock_widget_ in both the WebContents being destroyed and all its<span class="line"><!---->mouse_lock_widget_ in both the WebContents being destroyed and all its<!----></span><br>ancestor WebContents.  However, there's a time window where this<span class="line"><!---->ancestor WebContents.  However, there's a time window where this<!----></span><br>doesn't work with <webview>, where a mouse lock request in the guest<span class="line"><!---->doesn't work with &lt;webview&gt;, where a mouse lock request in the guest<!----></span><br>has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<span class="line"><!---->has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<!----></span><br>corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<span class="line"><!---->corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<!----></span><br>ends up destroying the <webview> guest while the guest's mouse lock<span class="line"><!---->ends up destroying the &lt;webview&gt; guest while the guest's mouse lock<!----></span><br>request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<span class="line"><!---->request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<!----></span><br>up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<span class="line"><!---->up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<!----></span><br>RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<span class="line"><!---->RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<!----></span><br>pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<span class="line"><!---->pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<!----></span><br>RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<span class="line"><!---->RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<!----></span><br>these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<span class="line"><!---->these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<!----></span><br>delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<span class="line"><!---->delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<!----></span><br>causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<span class="line"><!---->causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<!----></span><br>WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<!----></span><br><br>This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<span class="line"><!---->This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<!----></span><br>the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<span class="line"><!---->the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<!----></span><br>future, we could also investigate not setting mouse_lock_widget_<span class="line"><!---->future, we could also investigate not setting mouse_lock_widget_<!----></span><br>before we actually decide that a mouse lock request should proceed,<span class="line"><!---->before we actually decide that a mouse lock request should proceed,<!----></span><br>and removing the current implementation's dependency on that behavior.<span class="line"><!---->and removing the current implementation's dependency on that If the embedder<span class="line"><!---->corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<!----></span><br>ends up destroying the <webview> guest while the guest's mouse lock<span class="line"><!---->ends up destroying the &lt;webview&gt; guest while the guest's mouse lock<!----></span><br>request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<span class="line"><!---->request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<!----></span><br>up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<span class="line"><!---->up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<!----></span><br>RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<span class="line"><!---->RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<!----></span><br>pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<span class="line"><!---->pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $10,000 for this report based on being mitigated by needing to install an extension. This is only considered lightly/mildly mitigated in the updated Chrome VRP policies [1], the panel decided that it warranted much higher than that range due to the mitigation being the extension alone. Thank you for your efforts in reporting this issue to us and great work!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $10,000 for this report based on being mitigated by needing to install an extension. This is only considered lightly/mildly mitigated in the updated Chrome VRP policies [1], the panel decided that it warranted much higher than that range due to the mitigation being the extension alone. Thank you for your efforts in reporting this issue to us and great work!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by jtrro...@gmail.com (Jul 21, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by jtrro...@gmail.com (Jul 21, 2022)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by jtrro...@gmail.com (Jul 21, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by jtrro...@gmail.com (Jul 21, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>In ~WebContentsImpl, if mouse_lock_widget_ is non-nullptr, it then calls the member function RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary [1]. The mouse_lock_widget_ will not be assigned to nullptr if there is an ongoing lock mouse request and WebContentsImpl::GotResponseToLockMouseRequest has not been called [2]. If the lock mouse request comes from a Guest View and the outer webcontents removes the Guest View without responding the request, the mouse_lock_widget_ in outer webcontents instance will never be assigned to nullptr. This leads to UAF when the webcontents gets free.<span class="line"><!---->In ~WebContentsImpl, if mouse_lock_widget_ is non-nullptr, it then calls the member function RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary [1]. The mouse_lock_widget_ will not be assigned to nullptr if there is an ongoing lock mouse request and WebContentsImpl::GotResponseToLockMouseRequest has not been called [2]. If the lock mouse request comes from a Guest View and the outer webcontents removes the Guest View without responding the request, the mouse_lock_widget_ in outer webcontents instance will never be assigned to nullptr. This leads to UAF when the webcontents gets free.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/web_contents/web_contents_impl.cc;l=1032;drc=610603f89f0dd4da794848e4f8670a179efbcf38<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/web_contents/web_contents_impl.cc;l=1032;drc=610603f89f0dd4da794848e4f8670a179efbcf38"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/web_contents/web_contents_impl.cc;l=1032;drc=610603f89f0dd4da794848e4f8670a179efbcf38<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/web_contents/web_contents_impl.cc;l=5295;drc=610603f89f0dd4da794848e4f8670a179efbcf38<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/web_contents/web_contents_impl.cc;l=5295;drc=610603f89f0dd4da794848e4f8670a179efbcf38"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/web_contents/web_contents_impl.cc;l=5295;drc=610603f89f0dd4da794848e4f8670a179efbcf38<!----></a><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 103.0.5060.134 stable + dev<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 103.0.5060.134 stable + dev<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download the attached files to <dir><span class="line"><!---->1. Download the attached files to &lt;dir&gt;<!----></span><br>2. Setup HTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->2. Setup HTTPServer<!----></span><br>cd path/to/dir && python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8000<span class="line"><!---->cd path/to/dir &amp;&amp; python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8000<!----></span><br>3. Run<span class="line"><!---->3. Run<!----></span><br>out/Asan/chrome --load-extension=path/to/dir<span class="line"><!---->out/Asan/chrome --load-extension=path/to/dir<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: See asan.log<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: See asan.log<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I'm not familiar with this code or how inner WebContents (GuestViews) are implemented.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not familiar with this code or how inner WebContents (GuestViews) are implemented.<!----></span><br><br>It looks like we handle deletion of the RenderWidgetHost holding a mouse lock in WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted() by calling LostMouseLock() however it looks like we might not properly traverse up the tree of WebContents in that function because we return early if the WebContents of the RenderWidgetHost is not ourselves.<span class="line"><!---->It looks like we handle deletion of the RenderWidgetHost holding a mouse lock in WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted() by calling LostMouseLock() however it looks like we might not properly traverse up the tree of WebContents in that function because we return early if the WebContents of the RenderWidgetHost is not ourselves.<!----></span><br><br>Alex, I can take a look at this if you provide pointers on how the lifecycle of an inner WebContents works.<span class="line"><!---->Alex, I can take a look at this if you provide pointers on how the lifecycle of an inner WebContents works.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the report!  I'm just coming back after OOO now and will try to take a closer look at this.  I can also repro locally.  I'm not really familiar with the mouse lock code; lfg@ originally updated it to work with inner WebContents in <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report!  I'm just coming back after OOO now and will try to take a closer look at this.  I can also repro locally.  I'm not really familiar with the mouse lock code; lfg@ originally updated it to work with inner WebContents in <!----></span>r441258<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/441258"><!---->r441258<!----></a>, but he's no longer in Chrome.  Let me add mcnee@ or wjmaclean@ in case they know more.<span class="line"><!---->, but he's no longer in Chrome.  Let me add mcnee@ or wjmaclean@ in case they know more.<!----></span><br><br>Re: <span class="line"><!---->Re: <!----></span>#c4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c4"><!---->#c4<!----></a> about LostMouseLock: that seems like it should work properly for inner WebContents, since in the case where the widget's WebContents differs from the current one, it will just forward the call to the widget's WebContents, which will then walk over the chain of outer WebContents and clear mouse_lock_widget_ in each one.  The problem here seems to be that we never end up calling LostMouseLock() - we call RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() from ~WebContentsImpl when the inner WebContents gets destroyed, but that's not enough to get to LostMouseLock() when there's a request pending.  If the lock request is completed and not pending, it seems that RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary does eventually reach LostMouseLock() via UnlockMouse() [1].<span class="line"><!----> about LostMouseLock: that seems like it should work properly for inner WebContents, since in the case where the widget's WebContents differs from the current one, it will just forward the call to the widget's WebContents, which will then walk over the chain of outer WebContents and clear mouse_lock_widget_ in each one.  The problem here seems to be that we never end up calling LostMouseLock() - we call RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() from ~WebContentsImpl when the inner WebContents gets destroyed, but that's not enough to get to LostMouseLock() when there's a request pending.  If the lock request is completed and not pending, it seems that RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary does eventually reach LostMouseLock() via UnlockMouse() [1].<!----></span><br><br>Digging into the code a bit, I think this kind of problem first came up in <span class="line"><!---->Digging into the code a bit, I think this kind of problem first came up in <!----></span>issue 820593<span class="line"><!---->issue 820593<!----></span>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>where the call to RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() was added to ~WebContentsImpl in <span class="line"><!---->where the call to RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() was added to ~WebContentsImpl in <!----></span>r542865<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/542865"><!---->r542865<!----></a>.  It looks like that approach doesn't work for pending lock requests, though.<span class="line"><!---->.  It looks like that approach doesn't work for pending lock requests, though.<!----></span><br><br>For the fix, a straightforward idea is to walk the chain of WebContents and clear mouse_lock_widget_ in ~WebContentsImpl (similarly to LostMouseLock(), or maybe we can just call it directly).  I also wonder whether we really need to set mouse_lock_widget_ on the WebContents chain at the time we receive the request (before we've actually decided whether it should be approved), as opposed to the time the request is granted (after which RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() should be sufficient to ensure we clear mouse_lock_widget_ pointers).<span class="line"><!---->For the fix, a straightforward idea is to walk the chain of WebContents and clear mouse_lock_widget_ in ~WebContentsImpl (similarly to LostMouseLock(), or maybe we can just call it directly).  I also wonder whether we really need to set mouse_lock_widget_ on the WebContents chain at the time we receive the request (before we've actually decided whether it should be approved), as opposed to the time the request is granted (after which RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() should be sufficient to ensure we clear mouse_lock_widget_ pointers).<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_widget_host_view_event_handler.cc;l=216;drc=2fb84bdb28dcfe5eb7264f4e2f93ed4434d84f6b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_widget_host_view_event_handler.cc;l=216;drc=2fb84bdb28dcfe5eb7264f4e2f93ed4434d84f6b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_widget_host_view_event_handler.cc;l=216;drc=2fb84bdb28dcfe5eb7264f4e2f93ed4434d84f6b<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

This usually<span class="line"><!---->and calls RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() if so. However, there's a time window where this<!----></span><br>doesn't work with <webview>, where a mouse lock request in the guest<span class="line"><!---->doesn't work with &lt;webview&gt;, where a mouse lock request in the guest<!----></span><br>has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<span class="line"><!---->has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<!----></span><br>corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<span class="line"><!---->corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<!----></span><br>ends up destroying the <webview> guest while the guest's mouse lock<span class="line"><!---->ends up destroying the &lt;webview&gt; guest while the guest's mouse lock<!----></span><br>request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<span class="line"><!---->request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<!----></span><br>up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<span class="line"><!---->up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<!----></span><br>RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<span class="line"><!---->RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<!----></span><br>pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<span class="line"><!---->pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<!----></span><br>RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<span class="line"><!---->RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<!----></span><br>these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<span class="line"><!---->these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<!----></span><br>delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<span class="line"><!---->delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<!----></span><br>causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<span class="line"><!---->causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<!----></span><br>WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<!----></span><br><br>This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<span class="line"><!---->This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<!----></span><br>the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<span class="line"><!---->the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<!----></span><br>future, we could also investigate not setting mouse_lock_widget_<span class="line"><!---->future, we could also investigate not setting         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/859cf771d8364577cce49da5520b0e4b44ebb5a9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/859cf771d8364577cce49da5520b0e4b44ebb5a9"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/859cf771d8364577cce49da5520b0e4b44ebb5a9<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>859cf771d8364577cce49da5520b0e4b44ebb5a9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/859cf771d8364577cce49da5520b0e4b44ebb5a9"><!---->859cf771d8364577cce49da5520b0e4b44ebb5a9<!----></a><br>Author: Alex Moshchuk <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Alex Moshchuk &lt;<!----></span>alexmos@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/alexmos@chromium.org"><!---->alexmos@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Aug 18 23:51:27 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Aug 18 23:51:27 2022<!----></span><br><br>[M104] Ensure mouse lock widget pointers are cleared in WebContents destructor<span class="line"><!---->[M104] Ensure mouse lock widget pointers are cleared in WebContents destructor<!----></span><br><br>Requesting mouse/pointer lock (e.g., via requestPointerLock() from JS)<span class="line"><!---->Requesting mouse/pointer lock (e.g., via requestPointerLock() from JS)<!----></span><br>results in setting mouse_lock_widget_ to point to the<span class="line"><!---->results in setting mouse_lock_widget_ to point to the<!----></span><br>RenderWidgetHost that has the mouse lock, in both the widget's<span class="line"><!---->RenderWidgetHost that has the mouse lock, in both the widget's<!----></span><br>WebContents and all its outer WebContents.  When a WebContents is<span class="line"><!---->WebContents and all its outer WebContents.  When a WebContents is<!----></span><br>destroyed, it normally checks if it has an active mouse lock widget<span class="line"><!---->destroyed, it normally checks if it has an active mouse lock widget<!----></span><br>and calls RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() if so. This usually<span class="line"><!---->and calls RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() if so. This usually<!----></span><br>results in calling LostMouseLock(), which will clear<span class="line"><!---->results in calling LostMouseLock(), which will clear<!----></span><br>mouse_lock_widget_ in both the WebContents being destroyed and all its<span class="line"><!---->mouse_lock_widget_ in both the WebContents being destroyed and all its<!----></span><br>ancestor WebContents.  However, there's a time window where this<span class="line"><!---->ancestor WebContents.  However, there's a time window where this<!----></span><br>doesn't work with <webview>, where a mouse lock request in the guest<span class="line"><!---->doesn't work with &lt;webview&gt;, where a mouse lock request in the guest<!----></span><br>has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<span class="line"><!---->has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<!----></span><br>corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<span class="line"><!---->corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<!----></span><br>ends up destroying the <webview> guest while the guest's mouse lock<span class="line"><!---->ends up destroying the &lt;webview&gt; guest while the guest's mouse lock<!----></span><br>request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<span class="line"><!---->request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<!----></span><br>up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<span class="line"><!---->up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<!----></span><br>RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<span class="line"><!---->RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<!----></span><br>pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<span class="line"><!---->pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<!----></span><br>RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<span class="line"><!---->RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<!----></span><br>these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<span class="line"><!---->these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<!----></span><br>delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<span class="line"><!---->delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<!----></span><br>causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<span class="line"><!---->causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<!----></span><br>WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<!----></span><br><br>This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<span class="line"><!---->This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<!----></span><br>the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<span class="line"><!---->the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<!----></span><br>future, we could also investigate not setting mouse_lock_widget_<span class="line"><!---->future, we could also investigate not setting mouse_lock_widget_<!----></span><br>before we actually decide that a mouse lock request should proceed,<span class="line"><!---->before we actually decide that a mouse lock request should proceed,<!----></span><br>and removing the current implementation's dependency on that behavior.<span class="line"><!---->and removing the current implementation's dependency on that         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/bc29f62797c4f8eb59ac7b908775d859be957fc4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/bc29f62797c4f8eb59ac7b908775d859be957fc4"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/bc29f62797c4f8eb59ac7b908775d859be957fc4<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>bc29f62797c4f8eb59ac7b908775d859be957fc4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/bc29f62797c4f8eb59ac7b908775d859be957fc4"><!---->bc29f62797c4f8eb59ac7b908775d859be957fc4<!----></a><br>Author: Alex Moshchuk <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Alex Moshchuk &lt;<!----></span>alexmos@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/alexmos@chromium.org"><!---->alexmos@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Aug 19 00:38:50 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Aug 19 00:38:50 2022<!----></span><br><br>[M105] Ensure mouse lock widget pointers are cleared in WebContents destructor<span class="line"><!---->[M105] Ensure mouse lock widget pointers are cleared in WebContents destructor<!----></span><br><br>Requesting mouse/pointer lock (e.g., via requestPointerLock() from JS)<span class="line"><!---->Requesting mouse/pointer lock (e.g., via requestPointerLock() from JS)<!----></span><br>results in setting mouse_lock_widget_ to point to the<span class="line"><!---->results in setting mouse_lock_widget_ to point to the<!----></span><br>RenderWidgetHost that has the mouse lock, in both the widget's<span class="line"><!---->RenderWidgetHost that has the mouse lock, in both the widget's<!----></span><br>WebContents and all its outer WebContents.  When a WebContents is<span class="line"><!---->WebContents and all its outer WebContents.  When a WebContents is<!----></span><br>destroyed, it normally checks if it has an active mouse lock widget<span class="line"><!---->destroyed, it normally checks if it has an active mouse lock widget<!----></span><br>and calls RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() if so. This usually<span class="line"><!---->and calls RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() if so. This usually<!----></span><br>results in calling LostMouseLock(), which will clear<span class="line"><!---->results in calling LostMouseLock(), which will clear<!----></span><br>mouse_lock_widget_ in both the WebContents being destroyed and all its<span class="line"><!---->mouse_lock_widget_ in both the WebContents being destroyed and all its<!----></span><br>ancestor WebContents.  However, there's a time window where this<span class="line"><!---->ancestor WebContents.  However, there's a time window where this<!----></span><br>doesn't work with <webview>, where a mouse lock request in the guest<span class="line"><!---->doesn't work with &lt;webview&gt;, where a mouse lock request in the guest<!----></span><br>has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<span class="line"><!---->has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<!----></span><br>corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<span class="line"><!---->corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<!----></span><br>ends up destroying the <webview> guest while the guest's mouse lock<span class="line"><!---->ends up destroying the &lt;webview&gt; guest while the guest's mouse lock<!----></span><br>request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<span class="line"><!---->request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<!----></span><br>up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<span class="line"><!---->up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<!----></span><br>RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<span class="line"><!---->RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<!----></span><br>pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<span class="line"><!---->pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<!----></span><br>RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<span class="line"><!---->RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<!----></span><br>these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<span class="line"><!---->these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<!----></span><br>delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<span class="line"><!---->delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<!----></span><br>causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<span class="line"><!---->causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<!----></span><br>WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<!----></span><br><br>This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<span class="line"><!---->This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<!----></span><br>the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<span class="line"><!---->the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<!----></span><br>future, we could also investigate not setting mouse_lock_widget_<span class="line"><!---->future, we could also investigate not setting mouse_lock_widget_<!----></span><br>before we actually decide that a mouse lock request should proceed,<span class="line"><!---->before we actually decide that a mouse lock request should proceed,<!----></span><br>and removing the current implementation's dependency on that behavior.<span class="line"><!---->and removing the current implementation's dependency on that behavior.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>8380553a222cbc2c537ab67fc96e50f611ba4560<a class="undefined" However, there's a time window where this<span class="line"><!---->ancestor WebContents.  However, there's a time window where this<!----></span><br>doesn't work with <webview>, where a mouse lock request in the guest<span class="line"><!---->doesn't work with &lt;webview&gt;, where a mouse lock request in the guest<!----></span><br>has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<span class="line"><!---->has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<!----></span><br>corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<span class="line"><!---->corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<!----></span><br>ends up destroying the <webview> guest while the guest's mouse lock<span class="line"><!---->ends up destroying the &lt;webview&gt; guest while the guest's mouse lock<!----></span><br>request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<span class="line"><!---->request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<!----></span><br>up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<span class="line"><!---->up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<!----></span><br>RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<span class="line"><!---->RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<!----></span><br>pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<span class="line"><!---->pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<!----></span><br>RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<span class="line"><!---->RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<!----></span><br>these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<span class="line"><!---->these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<!----></span><br>delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<span class="line"><!---->delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<!----></span><br>causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<span class="line"><!---->causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<!----></span><br>WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<!----></span><br><br>This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<span class="line"><!---->This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<!----></span><br>the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<span class="line"><!---->the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<!----></span><br>future, we could also investigate not setting mouse_lock_widget_<span class="line"><!---->future, we could also investigate not setting mouse_lock_widget_<!----></span><br>before we actually decide that a mouse lock request should proceed,<span class="line"><!---->before we actually decide that a mouse lock request should However, there's a time window where this<span class="line"><!---->ancestor WebContents.  However, there's a time window where this<!----></span><br>doesn't work with <webview>, where a mouse lock request in the guest<span class="line"><!---->doesn't work with &lt;webview&gt;, where a mouse lock request in the guest<!----></span><br>has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<span class="line"><!---->has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<!----></span><br>corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<span class="line"><!---->corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<!----></span><br>ends up destroying the <webview> guest while the guest's mouse lock<span class="line"><!---->ends up destroying the &lt;webview&gt; guest while the guest's mouse lock<!----></span><br>request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<span class="line"><!---->request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<!----></span><br>up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<span class="line"><!---->up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<!----></span><br>RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<span class="line"><!---->RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<!----></span><br>pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<span class="line"><!---->pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<!----></span><br>RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<span class="line"><!---->RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<!----></span><br>these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<span class="line"><!---->these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<!----></span><br>delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<span class="line"><!---->delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<!----></span><br>causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<span class="line"><!---->causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<!----></span><br>WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<!----></span><br><br>This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<span class="line"><!---->This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<!----></span><br>the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<span class="line"><!---->the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<!----></span><br>future, we could also investigate not setting mouse_lock_widget_<span class="line"><!---->future, we could also investigate not setting         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products.         Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $10,000 for this report based on being mitigated by needing to install an extension. This is only considered lightly/mildly mitigated in the updated Chrome VRP policies [1], the panel decided that it warranted much higher than that range due to the mitigation being the extension alone. Thank you for your efforts in reporting this issue to us and great work!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $10,000 for this report based on being mitigated by needing to install an extension. This is only considered lightly/mildly mitigated in the updated Chrome VRP policies [1], the panel decided that it warranted much higher than that range due to the mitigation being the extension alone. Thank you for your efforts in reporting this issue to us and great work!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by jtrro...@gmail.com (Jul 21, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by jtrro...@gmail.com (Jul 21, 2022)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by jtrro...@gmail.com (Jul 21, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by jtrro...@gmail.com (Jul 21, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>In ~WebContentsImpl, if mouse_lock_widget_ is non-nullptr, it then calls the member function RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary [1]. The mouse_lock_widget_ will not be assigned to nullptr if there is an ongoing lock mouse request and WebContentsImpl::GotResponseToLockMouseRequest has not been called [2]. If the lock mouse request comes from a Guest View and the outer webcontents removes the Guest View without responding the request, the mouse_lock_widget_ in outer webcontents instance will never be assigned to nullptr. This leads to UAF when the webcontents gets free.<span class="line"><!---->In ~WebContentsImpl, if mouse_lock_widget_ is non-nullptr, it then calls the member function RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary [1]. The mouse_lock_widget_ will not be assigned to nullptr if there is an ongoing lock mouse request and WebContentsImpl::GotResponseToLockMouseRequest has not been called [2]. If the lock mouse request comes from a Guest View and the outer webcontents removes the Guest View without responding the request, the mouse_lock_widget_ in outer webcontents instance will never be assigned to nullptr. This leads to UAF when the webcontents gets free.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/web_contents/web_contents_impl.cc;l=1032;drc=610603f89f0dd4da794848e4f8670a179efbcf38<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/web_contents/web_contents_impl.cc;l=1032;drc=610603f89f0dd4da794848e4f8670a179efbcf38"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/web_contents/web_contents_impl.cc;l=1032;drc=610603f89f0dd4da794848e4f8670a179efbcf38<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/web_contents/web_contents_impl.cc;l=5295;drc=610603f89f0dd4da794848e4f8670a179efbcf38<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/web_contents/web_contents_impl.cc;l=5295;drc=610603f89f0dd4da794848e4f8670a179efbcf38"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/web_contents/web_contents_impl.cc;l=5295;drc=610603f89f0dd4da794848e4f8670a179efbcf38<!----></a><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 103.0.5060.134 stable + dev<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 103.0.5060.134 stable + dev<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download the attached files to <dir><span class="line"><!---->1. Download the attached files to &lt;dir&gt;<!----></span><br>2. Setup HTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->2. Setup HTTPServer<!----></span><br>cd path/to/dir && python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8000<span class="line"><!---->cd path/to/dir &amp;&amp; python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8000<!----></span><br>3. Run<span class="line"><!---->3. Run<!----></span><br>out/Asan/chrome --load-extension=path/to/dir<span class="line"><!---->out/Asan/chrome --load-extension=path/to/dir<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: See asan.log<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: See asan.log<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I'm not familiar with this code or how inner WebContents (GuestViews) are implemented.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not familiar with this code or how inner WebContents (GuestViews) are implemented.<!----></span><br><br>It looks like we handle deletion of the RenderWidgetHost holding a mouse lock in WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted() by calling LostMouseLock() however it looks like we might not properly traverse up the tree of WebContents in that function because we return early if the WebContents of the RenderWidgetHost is not ourselves.<span class="line"><!---->It looks like we handle deletion of the RenderWidgetHost holding a mouse lock in WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted() by calling LostMouseLock() however it looks like we might not properly traverse up the tree of WebContents in that function because we return early if the WebContents of the RenderWidgetHost is not ourselves.<!----></span><br><br>Alex, I can take a look at this if you provide pointers on how the lifecycle of an inner WebContents works.<span class="line"><!---->Alex, I can take a look at this if you provide pointers on how the lifecycle of an inner WebContents works.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the report!  I'm just coming back after OOO now and will try to take a closer look at this.  I can also repro locally.  I'm not really familiar with the mouse lock code; lfg@ originally updated it to work with inner WebContents in <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report!  I'm just coming back after OOO now and will try to take a closer look at this.  I can also repro locally.  I'm not really familiar with the mouse lock code; lfg@ originally updated it to work with inner WebContents in <!----></span>r441258<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/441258"><!---->r441258<!----></a>, but he's no longer in Chrome.  Let me add mcnee@ or wjmaclean@ in case they know more.<span class="line"><!---->, but he's no longer in Chrome.  Let me add mcnee@ or wjmaclean@ in case they know more.<!----></span><br><br>Re: <span class="line"><!---->Re: <!----></span>#c4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c4"><!---->#c4<!----></a> about LostMouseLock: that seems like it should work properly for inner WebContents, since in the case where the widget's WebContents differs from the current one, it will just forward the call to the widget's WebContents, which will then walk over the chain of outer WebContents and clear mouse_lock_widget_ in each one.  The problem here seems to be that we never end up calling LostMouseLock() - we call RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() from ~WebContentsImpl when the inner WebContents gets destroyed, but that's not enough to get to LostMouseLock() when there's a request pending.  If the lock request is completed and not pending, it seems that RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary does eventually reach LostMouseLock() via UnlockMouse() [1].<span class="line"><!----> about LostMouseLock: that seems like it should work properly for inner WebContents, since in the case where the widget's WebContents differs from the current one, it will just forward the call to the widget's WebContents, which will then walk over the chain of outer WebContents and clear mouse_lock_widget_ in each one.  The problem here seems to be that we never end up calling LostMouseLock() - we call RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() from ~WebContentsImpl when the inner WebContents gets destroyed, but that's not enough to get to LostMouseLock() when there's a request pending.  If the lock request is completed and not pending, it seems that RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary does eventually reach LostMouseLock() via UnlockMouse() [1].<!----></span><br><br>Digging into the code a bit, I think this kind of problem first came up in <span class="line"><!---->Digging into the code a bit, I think this kind of problem first came up in <!----></span>issue 820593<span class="line"><!---->issue 820593<!----></span>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>where the call to RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() was added to ~WebContentsImpl in <span class="line"><!---->where the call to RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() was added to ~WebContentsImpl in <!----></span>r542865<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/542865"><!---->r542865<!----></a>.  It looks like that approach doesn't work for pending lock requests, though.<span class="line"><!---->.  It looks like that approach doesn't work for pending lock requests, though.<!----></span><br><br>For the fix, a straightforward idea is to walk the chain of WebContents and clear mouse_lock_widget_ in ~WebContentsImpl (similarly to LostMouseLock(), or maybe we can just call it directly).  I also wonder whether we really need to set mouse_lock_widget_ on the WebContents chain at the time we receive the request (before we've actually decided whether it should be approved), as opposed to the time the request is granted (after which RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() should be sufficient to ensure we clear mouse_lock_widget_ pointers).<span class="line"><!---->For the fix, a straightforward idea is to walk the chain of WebContents and clear mouse_lock_widget_ in ~WebContentsImpl (similarly to LostMouseLock(), or maybe we can just call it directly).  I also wonder whether we really need to set mouse_lock_widget_ on the WebContents chain at the time we receive the request (before we've actually decided whether it should be approved), as opposed to the time the request is granted (after which RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() should be sufficient to ensure we clear mouse_lock_widget_ pointers).<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_widget_host_view_event_handler.cc;l=216;drc=2fb84bdb28dcfe5eb7264f4e2f93ed4434d84f6b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_widget_host_view_event_handler.cc;l=216;drc=2fb84bdb28dcfe5eb7264f4e2f93ed4434d84f6b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_widget_host_view_event_handler.cc;l=216;drc=2fb84bdb28dcfe5eb7264f4e2f93ed4434d84f6b<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

This usually<span class="line"><!---->and calls RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() if so. However, there's a time window where this<!----></span><br>doesn't work with <webview>, where a mouse lock request in the guest<span class="line"><!---->doesn't work with &lt;webview&gt;, where a mouse lock request in the guest<!----></span><br>has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<span class="line"><!---->has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<!----></span><br>corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<span class="line"><!---->corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<!----></span><br>ends up destroying the <webview> guest while the guest's mouse lock<span class="line"><!---->ends up destroying the &lt;webview&gt; guest while the guest's mouse lock<!----></span><br>request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<span class="line"><!---->request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<!----></span><br>up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<span class="line"><!---->up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<!----></span><br>RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<span class="line"><!---->RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<!----></span><br>pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<span class="line"><!---->pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<!----></span><br>RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<span class="line"><!---->RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<!----></span><br>these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<span class="line"><!---->these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<!----></span><br>delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<span class="line"><!---->delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<!----></span><br>causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<span class="line"><!---->causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<!----></span><br>WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<!----></span><br><br>This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<span class="line"><!---->This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<!----></span><br>the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<span class="line"><!---->the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<!----></span><br>future, we could also investigate not setting mouse_lock_widget_<span class="line"><!---->future, we could also investigate not setting         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/859cf771d8364577cce49da5520b0e4b44ebb5a9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/859cf771d8364577cce49da5520b0e4b44ebb5a9"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/859cf771d8364577cce49da5520b0e4b44ebb5a9<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>859cf771d8364577cce49da5520b0e4b44ebb5a9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/859cf771d8364577cce49da5520b0e4b44ebb5a9"><!---->859cf771d8364577cce49da5520b0e4b44ebb5a9<!----></a><br>Author: Alex Moshchuk <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Alex Moshchuk &lt;<!----></span>alexmos@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/alexmos@chromium.org"><!---->alexmos@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Aug 18 23:51:27 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Aug 18 23:51:27 2022<!----></span><br><br>[M104] Ensure mouse lock widget pointers are cleared in WebContents destructor<span class="line"><!---->[M104] Ensure mouse lock widget pointers are cleared in WebContents destructor<!----></span><br><br>Requesting mouse/pointer lock (e.g., via requestPointerLock() from JS)<span class="line"><!---->Requesting mouse/pointer lock (e.g., via requestPointerLock() from JS)<!----></span><br>results in setting mouse_lock_widget_ to point to the<span class="line"><!---->results in setting mouse_lock_widget_ to point to the<!----></span><br>RenderWidgetHost that has the mouse lock, in both the widget's<span class="line"><!---->RenderWidgetHost that has the mouse lock, in both the widget's<!----></span><br>WebContents and all its outer WebContents.  When a WebContents is<span class="line"><!---->WebContents and all its outer WebContents.  When a WebContents is<!----></span><br>destroyed, it normally checks if it has an active mouse lock widget<span class="line"><!---->destroyed, it normally checks if it has an active mouse lock widget<!----></span><br>and calls RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() if so. This usually<span class="line"><!---->and calls RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() if so. This usually<!----></span><br>results in calling LostMouseLock(), which will clear<span class="line"><!---->results in calling LostMouseLock(), which will clear<!----></span><br>mouse_lock_widget_ in both the WebContents being destroyed and all its<span class="line"><!---->mouse_lock_widget_ in both the WebContents being destroyed and all its<!----></span><br>ancestor WebContents.  However, there's a time window where this<span class="line"><!---->ancestor WebContents.  However, there's a time window where this<!----></span><br>doesn't work with <webview>, where a mouse lock request in the guest<span class="line"><!---->doesn't work with &lt;webview&gt;, where a mouse lock request in the guest<!----></span><br>has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<span class="line"><!---->has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<!----></span><br>corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<span class="line"><!---->corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<!----></span><br>ends up destroying the <webview> guest while the guest's mouse lock<span class="line"><!---->ends up destroying the &lt;webview&gt; guest while the guest's mouse lock<!----></span><br>request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<span class="line"><!---->request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<!----></span><br>up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<span class="line"><!---->up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<!----></span><br>RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<span class="line"><!---->RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<!----></span><br>pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<span class="line"><!---->pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<!----></span><br>RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<span class="line"><!---->RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<!----></span><br>these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<span class="line"><!---->these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<!----></span><br>delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<span class="line"><!---->delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<!----></span><br>causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<span class="line"><!---->causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<!----></span><br>WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<!----></span><br><br>This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<span class="line"><!---->This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<!----></span><br>the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<span class="line"><!---->the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<!----></span><br>future, we could also investigate not setting mouse_lock_widget_<span class="line"><!---->future, we could also investigate not setting mouse_lock_widget_<!----></span><br>before we actually decide that a mouse lock request should proceed,<span class="line"><!---->before we actually decide that a mouse lock request should proceed,<!----></span><br>and removing the current implementation's dependency on that behavior.<span class="line"><!---->and removing the current implementation's dependency on that         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/bc29f62797c4f8eb59ac7b908775d859be957fc4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/bc29f62797c4f8eb59ac7b908775d859be957fc4"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/bc29f62797c4f8eb59ac7b908775d859be957fc4<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>bc29f62797c4f8eb59ac7b908775d859be957fc4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/bc29f62797c4f8eb59ac7b908775d859be957fc4"><!---->bc29f62797c4f8eb59ac7b908775d859be957fc4<!----></a><br>Author: Alex Moshchuk <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Alex Moshchuk &lt;<!----></span>alexmos@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/alexmos@chromium.org"><!---->alexmos@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Aug 19 00:38:50 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Aug 19 00:38:50 2022<!----></span><br><br>[M105] Ensure mouse lock widget pointers are cleared in WebContents destructor<span class="line"><!---->[M105] Ensure mouse lock widget pointers are cleared in WebContents destructor<!----></span><br><br>Requesting mouse/pointer lock (e.g., via requestPointerLock() from JS)<span class="line"><!---->Requesting mouse/pointer lock (e.g., via requestPointerLock() from JS)<!----></span><br>results in setting mouse_lock_widget_ to point to the<span class="line"><!---->results in setting mouse_lock_widget_ to point to the<!----></span><br>RenderWidgetHost that has the mouse lock, in both the widget's<span class="line"><!---->RenderWidgetHost that has the mouse lock, in both the widget's<!----></span><br>WebContents and all its outer WebContents.  When a WebContents is<span class="line"><!---->WebContents and all its outer WebContents.  When a WebContents is<!----></span><br>destroyed, it normally checks if it has an active mouse lock widget<span class="line"><!---->destroyed, it normally checks if it has an active mouse lock widget<!----></span><br>and calls RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() if so. This usually<span class="line"><!---->and calls RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() if so. This usually<!----></span><br>results in calling LostMouseLock(), which will clear<span class="line"><!---->results in calling LostMouseLock(), which will clear<!----></span><br>mouse_lock_widget_ in both the WebContents being destroyed and all its<span class="line"><!---->mouse_lock_widget_ in both the WebContents being destroyed and all its<!----></span><br>ancestor WebContents.  However, there's a time window where this<span class="line"><!---->ancestor WebContents.  However, there's a time window where this<!----></span><br>doesn't work with <webview>, where a mouse lock request in the guest<span class="line"><!---->doesn't work with &lt;webview&gt;, where a mouse lock request in the guest<!----></span><br>has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<span class="line"><!---->has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<!----></span><br>corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<span class="line"><!---->corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<!----></span><br>ends up destroying the <webview> guest while the guest's mouse lock<span class="line"><!---->ends up destroying the &lt;webview&gt; guest while the guest's mouse lock<!----></span><br>request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<span class="line"><!---->request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<!----></span><br>up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<span class="line"><!---->up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<!----></span><br>RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<span class="line"><!---->RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<!----></span><br>pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<span class="line"><!---->pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<!----></span><br>RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<span class="line"><!---->RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<!----></span><br>these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<span class="line"><!---->these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<!----></span><br>delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<span class="line"><!---->delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<!----></span><br>causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<span class="line"><!---->causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<!----></span><br>WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<!----></span><br><br>This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<span class="line"><!---->This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<!----></span><br>the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<span class="line"><!---->the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<!----></span><br>future, we could also investigate not setting mouse_lock_widget_<span class="line"><!---->future, we could also investigate not setting mouse_lock_widget_<!----></span><br>before we actually decide that a mouse lock request should proceed,<span class="line"><!---->before we actually decide that a mouse lock request should proceed,<!----></span><br>and removing the current implementation's dependency on that behavior.<span class="line"><!---->and removing the current implementation's dependency on that behavior.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>8380553a222cbc2c537ab67fc96e50f611ba4560<a class="undefined" However, there's a time window where this<span class="line"><!---->ancestor WebContents.  However, there's a time window where this<!----></span><br>doesn't work with <webview>, where a mouse lock request in the guest<span class="line"><!---->doesn't work with &lt;webview&gt;, where a mouse lock request in the guest<!----></span><br>has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<span class="line"><!---->has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<!----></span><br>corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<span class="line"><!---->corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<!----></span><br>ends up destroying the <webview> guest while the guest's mouse lock<span class="line"><!---->ends up destroying the &lt;webview&gt; guest while the guest's mouse lock<!----></span><br>request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<span class="line"><!---->request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<!----></span><br>up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<span class="line"><!---->up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<!----></span><br>RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<span class="line"><!---->RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<!----></span><br>pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<span class="line"><!---->pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<!----></span><br>RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<span class="line"><!---->RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<!----></span><br>these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<span class="line"><!---->these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<!----></span><br>delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<span class="line"><!---->delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<!----></span><br>causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<span class="line"><!---->causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<!----></span><br>WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<!----></span><br><br>This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<span class="line"><!---->This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<!----></span><br>the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<span class="line"><!---->the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<!----></span><br>future, we could also investigate not setting mouse_lock_widget_<span class="line"><!---->future, we could also investigate not setting mouse_lock_widget_<!----></span><br>before we actually decide that a mouse lock request should proceed,<span class="line"><!---->before we actually decide that a mouse lock request should However, there's a time window where this<span class="line"><!---->ancestor WebContents.  However, there's a time window where this<!----></span><br>doesn't work with <webview>, where a mouse lock request in the guest<span class="line"><!---->doesn't work with &lt;webview&gt;, where a mouse lock request in the guest<!----></span><br>has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<span class="line"><!---->has to go up to the embedder to asynchronously ask it for the<!----></span><br>corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<span class="line"><!---->corresponding permission before it can be granted.  If the embedder<!----></span><br>ends up destroying the <webview> guest while the guest's mouse lock<span class="line"><!---->ends up destroying the &lt;webview&gt; guest while the guest's mouse lock<!----></span><br>request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<span class="line"><!---->request is pending (prior to responding to that request), it could end<!----></span><br>up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<span class="line"><!---->up with a stale mouse_lock_widget_ pointer, since<!----></span><br>RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<span class="line"><!---->RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary() follows a different path for<!----></span><br>pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<span class="line"><!---->pending requests and doesn't clear those pointers.  Sadly, the<!----></span><br>RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<span class="line"><!---->RenderWidgetHost destruction is also not going to trigger clearing<!----></span><br>these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<span class="line"><!---->these pointers as it normally does, since ~WebContentsImpl clears<!----></span><br>delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<span class="line"><!---->delegate_ pointers for all of its widgets before destroying them,<!----></span><br>causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<span class="line"><!---->causing ~RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy() to not call<!----></span><br>WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<span class="line"><!---->WebContentsImpl::RenderWidgetDeleted(), which normally does this.<!----></span><br><br>This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<span class="line"><!---->This CL ensures that all mouse_lock_widget_ pointers are cleared on<!----></span><br>the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<span class="line"><!---->the entire WebContents chain in the WebContentsImpl destructor. In the<!----></span><br>future, we could also investigate not setting mouse_lock_widget_<span class="line"><!---->future, we could also investigate not setting         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
